title: Continuum (set theory)
summary: In the mathematical field of set theory, the continuum means the real numbers, or the corresponding (infinite) cardinal number, denoted by c {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {c}}} .[1][2] Georg Cantor proved that the cardinality c {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {c}}} is larger than the smallest infinity, namely, ℵ 0 {\displaystyle \aleph _{0}} . He also proved that c {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {c}}} is equal to 2 ℵ 0 {\displaystyle 2^{\aleph _{0}}\!} , the cardinality of the power set of the natural numbers.
